title: I.Sicily inscription 001109
support: Upper right part of a rectangular plaque of local stone. Part of the upper and right margins are preserved.

layout.p: Remains of two lines of text preserved, with slightly irregular right margin to the lines.

handNote.lettering: Regular, deeply incised letters, of which alpha the widest. Borken bar alpha; epsilon has shorter middle bar; Mu has vertical first and last, with middle strokes only descending half-way; omicron is small and mid-line; rho is rounded and closed; sigma is regular four bar, with horizontal top and bottom, middle strokes half-width.

provenanceFound._: Recovered from the ruins of the ancient city (so Salinas).

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Archeologico Regionale Antonino Salinas
museum.description: Partially reopened following extensive restoration work. Comprehensive collection of archaeological material, predominantly from the West of the island, with an important Etruscan collection.

location.address: Centre of Palermo, Piazza Olivella 24, 90100 - Palermo
